Entries.default: "Green islands and blue skies."
"The locals don't know how good they have it."
"The Huana have a paradise, yet they do not protect it."
"Where are the walls? The artillery?"
"Can you believe your eyes? I've never seen such a fair, pristine land."
She nods.
"You two seem awfully enchanted with the view."
[Shrug.]
"If you like this, you must see the jungles of Aedyr and the valleys of the Living Lands!"
"It's the land - fertile, green, and abundant."
"I've heard they're grand, but I can't imagine they compare to this."
"You must be used to views like this." She rolls her eyes.
"I was on duty when Magran's Teeth went. Saw the smoke from here."
"Just when I thought this place was looking safer than the rough country."
Two guards gaze over the ramparts at the vista: Queen's Berth shining in the near distance, and the rippling sea beyond.
"Are you afraid that colossus will come here?"
"Never! And if it does, that's what our cannons are for."
"I'm sure the trenchers at Hasongo thought the same thing."
"Deadfire is certainly a special place."

"I grew up surrounded by storms and stones.

"Rauatai is my soul, but this place has enchanted me." He blinks quickly, as if afraid to miss the view, even for a moment.

"No, it's something else.

"I just can't put my finger on what." He scratches the back of his head and squints, perhaps hoping to find the answer somewhere in the view.
"Deadfire is a vast archipelago rich in resources."
"You're drawn to the potential it represents."
"The worth of Deadfire lies with its people - never forget that."
"It's the mystery - the Engwithan ruins, ancient tales..."
"I couldn't tell you."
"Don't tell me you're not impressed. Or do you really prefer ice and tundra to this?"
She shakes her head at you and returns to the view.
She nods. "There's so much here. So much we could make of this place."
"Perhaps that's it." He turns back to the view, drinking it in.
"I don't place much stock in that. Deadfire is a land of plenty. A promise to our people." She looks to her friend.
"And who are its people? The Huana of old? Or the pirates who live here now?"
"Deadfire belongs to those who can master and build upon it. "That is what's exciting." She nods at the expansive vista.
She shrugs. "Deadfire is another frontier - rich with potential and ready to be built. "That is what's exciting." She nods at the expansive vista.
"At last, Deadfire joins with Rauatai."
"Do you think it will remain green?"
"There's so much we could build in Deadfire."
"This is a fine land."
